A CircuitBreaker calls this method after its own directTransition() completes.

A CircuitBreaker calls this method as soon as its own directTransition() method is invoked.

C

cb - Variable in class co.codecraft.jcircuit.TransitionPolicy
 
Circuit - Class in co.codecraft.jcircuit
A Circuit proxies a code path, action, or feature that needs to be gracefully degraded or disabled in some circumstances.
Circuit(Circuit.Listener) - Constructor for class co.codecraft.jcircuit.Circuit
Create a new Circuit object that proxies the state of a code path or action/feature.
circuit - Variable in class co.codecraft.jcircuit.CircuitBreaker
 
circuit - Variable in class co.codecraft.jcircuit.TransitionPolicy
 
Circuit.Listener - Interface in co.codecraft.jcircuit
Receive notifications just after the circuit changes state (e.g., from CLOSED to OPEN).
CircuitBreaker - Class in co.codecraft.jcircuit
Encapsulates the circuit breaker design pattern described by Michael Nygard in Release It! See "Don't Forget the Circuit Breakers" for a discussion.
CircuitBreaker(TransitionPolicy, Circuit.Listener) - Constructor for class co.codecraft.jcircuit.CircuitBreaker
Create a new CircuitBreaker that transitions per the specified policy.
closeAtGoodRatio - Variable in class co.codecraft.jcircuit.TimedRatioPolicy
Deem an open circuit breaker "repaired" and close it if, while resetting, we see a ratio of good:all pulses >= this value.
CLOSED - Static variable in class co.codecraft.jcircuit.Circuit
The circuit is closed.
co.codecraft.jcircuit - package co.codecraft.jcircuit
 

D

directTransition(int, boolean) - Method in class co.codecraft.jcircuit.CircuitBreaker
Directly transition the Circuit managed by this CircuitBreaker to a specific state, without waiting for a policy to trigger the transition.
DirectTransitionPolicy - Class in co.codecraft.jcircuit
Does nothing in response to events, allowing transitions to be controlled solely by calls to CircuitBreaker.directTransition(int, boolean).
DirectTransitionPolicy() - Constructor for class co.codecraft.jcircuit.DirectTransitionPolicy
 

E

evalEveryNMillis - Variable in class co.codecraft.jcircuit.TimedRatioPolicy
Determines how often we cut data into a "slice" against which ratios can be evaluated, and thus the max speed with which transitions in the circuit can occur.

F

failAfterNBadResets - Variable in class co.codecraft.jcircuit.TimedRatioPolicy
Fail a circuit breaker after attempting to reset (and failing), this many times in a row.
FAILED - Static variable in class co.codecraft.jcircuit.Circuit
The circuit is in a permanent failure state.

listener - Variable in class co.codecraft.jcircuit.Circuit
Receive notifications when the state of the circuit changes.

M

minSliceCount - Variable in class co.codecraft.jcircuit.TimedRatioPolicy
The minimum number of pulses that must be seen to make a slice valid for analysis.

O

onAltPulse() - Method in class co.codecraft.jcircuit.CircuitBreaker
Tell the circuit breaker that we just did an alternate unit of work because the circuit was open.

Notify the policy that we did normal work and succeeded.
OPEN - Static variable in class co.codecraft.jcircuit.Circuit
The circuit is open (tripped by some kind of problem).
openAtGoodRatio - Variable in class co.codecraft.jcircuit.TimedRatioPolicy
Open a closed circuit breaker if we see a ratio of good:all that is <= this value.

R

resetAfterNMillis - Variable in class co.codecraft.jcircuit.TimedRatioPolicy
Determines when we are ready to attempt a reset, after having an open circuit for a while.
RESETTING - Static variable in class co.codecraft.jcircuit.Circuit
The circuit is attempting to transition from OPEN to CLOSED; in other words, the system has been unhealthy, but we are now re-evaluating, hoping to see health again.

S

scheduledExecutorService - Static variable in class co.codecraft.jcircuit.CircuitBreaker
Provides a thread that TransitionPolicy objects can use to monitor circuit breakers that do very light work on a schedule (e.g., to check something periodically).
setCloseAtGoodRatio(double) - Method in class co.codecraft.jcircuit.TimedRatioPolicy.Builder

shouldTryNormalPath() - Method in class co.codecraft.jcircuit.CircuitBreaker
Public users of the circuit breaker should call this method at the beginning of each pulse to decide whether to attempt normal or alternate/fallback work.
shouldValidate - Variable in class co.codecraft.jcircuit.Circuit
Setting this to true causes Circuit.transition(int, int) to execute a handful of conditionals to test that the start and end state of a transition actually match the rules of our state machine.
STATE_MASK - Static variable in class co.codecraft.jcircuit.Circuit
Use this constant to mask the current state snapshot (see Circuit.getStateSnapshot() into a value like Circuit.OPEN or Circuit.CLOSED for a simplified view of the circuit breaker's state machine.
stateToString(int) - Static method in class co.codecraft.jcircuit.Circuit
Converts a state constant such as Circuit.CLOSED to a string such as "CLOSED".
stringToState(String) - Static method in class co.codecraft.jcircuit.Circuit
Converts a string such as "CLOSED" to a state constant such as Circuit.CLOSED.

T

TimedRatioPolicy - Class in co.codecraft.jcircuit
Provides a simple transition policy where all rules are expressed in terms of ratios of good and bad pulses, calculated at regularly timed intervals.
TimedRatioPolicy(double, double, int, int, int, int) - Constructor for class co.codecraft.jcircuit.TimedRatioPolicy
Establish numeric thresholds that embody our policy.
TimedRatioPolicy.Builder - Class in co.codecraft.jcircuit
A convenience class to make constructor parameters less opaque.
transition(int, int) - Method in class co.codecraft.jcircuit.Circuit
Attempt to move our state machine to a new state.
transitionPolicy - Variable in class co.codecraft.jcircuit.CircuitBreaker
Implements transition decisions for this circuit breaker.
TransitionPolicy - Class in co.codecraft.jcircuit
Used by a CircuitBreaker to control the manner and timing of transitions in its Circuit.
TransitionPolicy() - Constructor for class co.codecraft.jcircuit.TransitionPolicy
